description: Asian Insider brings you insights into a fast-changing region from our network of correspondents and commentators. Read more at straitstimes.com.
title: Asian Insider: JI terror group dissolves in Indonesia | Deadly stampede in India
title_page: Asian Insider: JI terror group dissolves in Indonesia | Deadly stampede in India | The Straits Times
maintext:
Dear ST reader,
Key members of the Jemaah Islamiyah (JI) terror group in Indonesia have dissolved the organisation and pledged to align its educational curriculum with mainstream Islamic beliefs. However, analysts caution that the group remains a potent force. Arlina Arshad reports.
Beijing and Manila have agreed to “restore trust and rebuild confidence” in the South China Sea after a face-off between the Chinese coast guard and Philippine naval vessels on Jun 17. Despite the positive signals, Mara Cepeda and Lim Min Zhang note that there is little sign that both sides will step down on their sovereignty claims.
Amid China’s slowing economy,local governments are facing pressure to service their debts. Lim Min Zhang reports on how funds meant for meals for poor rural children are being diverted by county authorities to meet the shortfall.
Over in northern India, a deadly stampede during a prayer meeting on July 2 led to 121 people being killed. Nirmala Ganapathy looks into the safety lapses during the event where people rushed to see a flamboyant guru in Uttar Pradesh state.
Our Insight story over the weekend was on Australia’s infrastructure boom. With major airport, road and rail projects in the works, Jonathan Pearlman looks at whether the country can afford the huge price tag.
